320dcb48be9baac3d2b69ca1af708c29 (08:43): no listening sockets available, shutting down
d2e92b5ff3bf1e2c4932dbfeb29a0148 (08:44): re: NTP servers... here's teh master list of public Network Time Protocol servers. read carefully. http://ntp.isc.org/bin/view/Servers/WebHome

7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (08:46): DataStream, yeah good idea, now do it remotely on a x86 box a 1000 miles away
320dcb48be9baac3d2b69ca1af708c29 (08:46): what's the command to check to see what's listening on port 80
d2e92b5ff3bf1e2c4932dbfeb29a0148 (08:48): lsof, but you have to find and install it
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (08:50): and see what errors it produces...
320dcb48be9baac3d2b69ca1af708c29 (08:51): [pid 11695] open("/var/run/apache2.pid", O_RDONLY) = -1 ENOENT (No such file or directory)
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (08:52): okay it openned  apache2.pid  ... and was there... that is not a problem
320dcb48be9baac3d2b69ca1af708c29 (08:53): [pid 11818] connect(7, {sa_family=AF_FILE, path="/var/run/.nscd_socket"}, 110) = -1 ENOENT (No such file or directory)
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (08:54): karrot-x is that the last error?
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (08:54): focus on the last errror...  its the one that killed it

320dcb48be9baac3d2b69ca1af708c29 (08:55): [pid 11818] bind(3, {sa_family=AF_INET6, sin6_port=htons(80), inet_pton(AF_INET6, "::", &sin6_addr), sin6_flowinfo=0, sin6_scope_id=0}, 28) = -1 EADDRINUSE (Address already in use)
320dcb48be9baac3d2b69ca1af708c29 (08:55): that looks like error to me
d2e92b5ff3bf1e2c4932dbfeb29a0148 (08:55): is your system configured for IPV6 ?
320dcb48be9baac3d2b69ca1af708c29 (08:55): then it goes into the error output that you already see
d2e92b5ff3bf1e2c4932dbfeb29a0148 (08:55): then why is apache trying to use it?
d2e92b5ff3bf1e2c4932dbfeb29a0148 (08:56): thats what  [::]:80 was about too, thats a ipv6 wildcard
d2e92b5ff3bf1e2c4932dbfeb29a0148 (08:59): the equivalent of 0.0.0.0:80 in ipv4
320dcb48be9baac3d2b69ca1af708c29 (09:00): hmm i checking all my shit

d2e92b5ff3bf1e2c4932dbfeb29a0148 (09:01): make sure your apache.conf file isn't listening to ipv6.  i have no idea what vhost.conf is, mine has always run almost entirely on /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf
